resources.string: "After the super power saving mode is activated, some comfort functions will be turned off and power performance will be adjusted to improve the vehicle\'s range. Please pay attention to the following matters before enabling the super power saving mode: (1) Power performance will be weakened, and some driving setting functions will not be selectable. (2) The air conditioning and wireless phone charging functions will be turned off (can be manually turned on again). (3) Functions such as the car refrigerator (if any), seat comfort, head-up display, steering wheel heating, ambient lighting, and multimedia volume adjustment will not be available. (4) After the vehicle is locked or charged, the super power saving mode will automatically exit, and you can also manually click the switch to exit this mode. "
The reading lamp turns on automatically when the car is unlocked or the door is opened
Enter the designated road section, the system will automatically change lanes to overtake and control the distance to the vehicle in front
Rear Cross Traffic Alert and Assist

After activation, when the user activates the turn signal during LCC operation, the system will assist the user in changing lanes. After deactivation, when the user activates the turn signal during LCC operation, LCC will downgrade to ACC
After deactivation, NZP Intelligent Navigation and NZP Autonomous Navigation functions cannot be used. Are you sure you want to deactivate?
The speed limit value is derived from the result of big data integration of the current road
When conditions are met, changing gears will automatically activate the corresponding parking in and out function
When the gear is shifted to D or R, the APA function is activated
Enter the designated road section and realize intelligent assisted driving according to the navigation route set by the user

After it is turned on, when the system automatically changes lanes, it will remind the user that the lane is about to change, and the user needs to confirm the lane change by turning the turn signal lever.

"After disabling forward collision mitigation, when the vehicle approaches a forward collision object, the system will not be able to automatically mitigate the collision. Are you sure you want to disable this function?"
When the turn signal is activated in D gear, the central control screen displays the corresponding side blind spot view, enhancing driving safety and convenience

When the turn signal is activated in D gear, the central control screen displays the corresponding side blind spot view, enhancing driving safety and convenience; this switch is automatically turned on after the passenger seat rotates 180°

"To enhance the intelligent driving assistance experience, we have developed a vehicle data sharing feature that uses shared external camera data to enhance the learning and recognition of lane lines, road signs, and traffic light positions. We invite you to enable data sharing and co-create the driving experience. The data you share will be strictly protected and will not be associated with you or your vehicle during the upload process. You can enable or disable the data sharing feature at any time. For details, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'Connected Vehicle Personal Information Protection Policy\' and the \'User Manual\'."
Warn when a moving object is approaching from behind to prevent accidents when opening a door.

After disabling the forward collision mitigation function, when the vehicle detects a potential collision risk, the system will not be able to provide automatic emergency braking. If closed, this function will automatically reopen when the vehicle restarts.

After disabling the forward collision warning function, when the vehicle detects a potential collision risk, the system will not be able to provide collision warning. If closed, this function will automatically reopen when the vehicle restarts.

"After disabling the forward collision warning, when the vehicle approaches a forward collision object, the system will not be able to provide an alarm. Are you sure you want to disable this function?"

When the vehicle is in D gear and the turn signal is activated, the central control screen displays the corresponding side blind spot view, enhancing driving safety and convenience. This switch is automatically turned on after the passenger seat rotates 180 degrees.

"When the vehicle is reversing, it actively monitors the risk of side-rear collisions and alerts the driver through the instrument display and sound prompts, using active braking if necessary to avoid or mitigate the impact of a collision.
The Rear Cross Traffic Alert and Assist function only serves to remind and slow down vehicles crossing from the side-rear when reversing. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the Lane Centering Assist function is active, and the lever lane change assist switch is on, the system will autonomously change to the corresponding side lane when the driver activates the turn signal lever and the vehicle status and road environment meet the lane change requirements.
The lever lane change assist function is mainly suitable for expressways, highways, elevated roads, and other medium to high-speed closed road sections. It requires good lighting, clear lane markings, and lane change space in both the current and target lanes. Do not use this function on urban streets. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."
When the vehicle is in D gear and the turn signal is activated, the central control screen displays the corresponding side blind spot view, enhancing driving safety and convenience.

"This function can monitor the side-rear blind spot of the driver\'s view in real-time. If another vehicle enters the blind spot, it will alert the driver through the external rearview mirror warning light, instrument display, and optional sound.
The blind zone warning is only a reminder function and is not always effective in all situations. Drivers must always pay attention to the road traffic environment when changing lanes. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the vehicle is parked and the driver or passenger is about to open the door, if another vehicle is detected approaching from the side-rear, this function will alert of the risk through the external rearview mirror warning light, instrument display, and sound. The driver or passenger needs to confirm whether it is safe to open the door.
The door opening warning is only a reminder function and is not always effective in all situations. Drivers and passengers must always pay attention to the surrounding environment of the vehicle. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When there is an unavoidable collision in front or to the side-front of the vehicle, this function will actively brake to avoid or mitigate the impact of the collision. The forward collision mitigation function will automatically activate when the vehicle restarts.
Forward collision mitigation cannot completely avoid all collision risks. Drivers must wear seat belts and always pay attention to the road conditions ahead. This function will not activate at speeds below 4 km/h or in reverse. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When there is a high-risk collision situation in front or to the side-front of the vehicle, this function will alert the driver to pay attention to the road conditions ahead through the instrument display, sound, or light braking. The forward collision warning function will automatically activate when the vehicle restarts.
The forward collision warning function cannot handle all road conditions. Drivers need to always pay attention to road conditions and control the vehicle in a timely manner. This function will not activate at speeds below 30 km/h or in reverse. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

When the vehicle is detected to be making an unintentional departure from its lane on a road with clear lane markings, the Lane Keeping Assistance function controls the steering wheel to assist the driver in correcting the vehicle back to its lane and alerts the driver through visual and auditory means.

"The NZP Highway Autonomous Navigation Assist function is applicable to highways and some closed urban expressways that support this feature (subject to the actual supported road sections). You can activate this function by pressing the gear lever twice consecutively. This function assists the vehicle in driving along the set navigation route and has the capability of lever lane change, overtaking lane change, and assisting in entering and exiting ramps.
[Lane Change Confirmation] When enabled, the vehicle will issue a lane change confirmation request when initiating a lane change. The driver can confirm the lane change request by pressing the confirmation button on the left side of the steering wheel or by moving the turn signal lever in the direction of the lane change. After confirming the lane change request, the vehicle will automatically change lanes at an appropriate time; if the lane change request is not confirmed, the vehicle will not change lanes automatically. When the lane change confirmation function is disabled, the vehicle will not issue a lane change confirmation request and will autonomously change lanes at an appropriate time.
[Overtaking Lane Change] This function assists the driver in changing lanes to overtake slower vehicles: When "Off" is selected, the vehicle will not autonomously initiate an overtaking lane change; When "Standard" is selected, this function will initiate overtaking lane changes less frequently; When "Agile" is selected, this function will initiate overtaking lane changes more frequently.
As a driving assist function, the NZP Highway Autonomous Navigation Assist cannot handle all traffic and environmental conditions and may exit when conditions are not met, requiring the driver to take over promptly. Drivers need to always pay attention to traffic conditions and the road environment, keep their hands on the steering wheel, and be ready to take over the vehicle. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"[Road Speed Limit Deviation] There are two options: When selecting \'km/h\', the driver can adjust the vehicle speed limit within a range of ±20 km/h of the road speed limit; When selecting \'%\', the driver can adjust the vehicle speed limit within a range of ±20% of the road speed limit. Note: During the operation of the Highway Autonomous Navigation, Lane Centering Assist, or Adaptive Cruise Control functions, when the driver presses and holds the gear lever down, the vehicle will adjust the cruise speed based on the road speed limit information and the user-set speed limit deviation.
The road speed limit values provided by the system are not always accurate. Drivers must still comply with current traffic laws and regulations, set the target speed according to actual road conditions, and always pay attention to speed and traffic environment to avoid traffic violations. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"The driver can choose between \'Standard\' and \'Concise\' voice broadcasting modes. The voice broadcasting function is only applicable to driving and parking functions.
The voice broadcasting function has limitations and may not always provide timely and complete prompts in all situations. Please always pay attention to the actual driving and parking conditions and drive safely."

"This function can recognize road speed limit signs and display the current road speed limit value on the instrument panel. When the vehicle speed exceeds the current road speed limit value and the user-set deviation value, this function will remind the driver to pay attention to the speed through the instrument speed limit icon (optional sound reminder).
[Overspeed Reminder Deviation] There are two adjustment methods: When selecting \'km/h\', the driver can adjust the overspeed reminder deviation value within a range of ±20 km/h of the road speed limit; When selecting \'%\', the driver can adjust the overspeed reminder deviation value within a range of ±20% of the road speed limit.
[Other Traffic Signs] The function can recognize some prohibition and warning signs and display them on the instrument panel to remind the driver.
This function can only recognize some standard and clearly visible traffic signs and may not correctly recognize traffic signs in all situations. Drivers must always pay attention to the road traffic environment. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."
超级省电模式开启中该功能不可用，请关闭后尝试”

"When the Lane Centering Assist function is active and the lever lane change switch is on, the vehicle will autonomously change to the corresponding side lane when the driver moves the turn signal lever to one side, provided the vehicle status and road environment meet the lane change requirements.
The lever lane change is mainly suitable for expressways, highways, elevated roads, and other medium to high-speed closed road sections. It requires good lighting, clear lane markings, and lane change space in both the current and target lanes. Do not use this function on urban streets. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the automatic parking function is not activated: (1) Gear activation for parking in: When the system detects an available parking space in the background, the driver stops the vehicle and shifts the gear to R, activating the parking function to enter the automatic parking interface; (2) Gear activation for parking out: If the last parking process was system-assisted parking in, and the vehicle has not moved after parking, the driver shifts the current gear from P to D or R, activating the parking function to enter the automatic parking out interface.
Gear activation for parking is only a convenient way to open the parking function; you still need to pay attention to the surrounding environment during the parking process."

"When the backward crossing warning and assistance function is enabled, the system will actively monitor the risk of side-rear collisions when the vehicle is reversing and alert the driver through the instrument display, sound, and external rearview mirror warning light. If necessary, it will use active braking and seatbelt pre-tensioning to avoid or mitigate the impact of a collision.
The backward crossing warning and assistance function only serves to remind and slow down vehicles crossing from the side-rear when reversing. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the blind zone warning function is enabled, the system can monitor the side-rear blind zone of the driver\'s field of vision in real-time. If another vehicle enters the blind zone, it will alert the driver through the external rearview mirror warning light, instrument display, and optional sound.
The blind zone warning is only an active prompt function and is not always effective in all situations. Drivers still need to pay attention to the road traffic environment when changing lanes. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the door open warning function is enabled, if the vehicle is stationary and the driver or passenger is about to open the door, and the system detects another vehicle approaching from the side-rear, this function will alert of the risk through the external rearview mirror warning light, instrument display, and sound. The driver or passenger needs to confirm whether it is safe to open the door.
The door open warning is only an active prompt function and is not always effective in all situations. Drivers and passengers still need to pay attention to the surrounding environment of the vehicle. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the forward collision mitigation function is enabled, if the system detects an imminent collision in front or to the side-front of the vehicle, this function will actively brake to avoid or mitigate the impact of the collision. The forward collision mitigation function will automatically activate when the vehicle restarts.
Forward collision mitigation cannot completely avoid all collision risks. Drivers need to fasten their seatbelts and always pay attention to the road conditions ahead. This function will not activate at speeds below 4 km/h or in reverse. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the forward collision warning function is enabled, if the system detects a high-risk collision situation in front or to the side-front of the vehicle, this function will alert the driver to pay attention to the road conditions ahead through the instrument display, sound, text, or light braking. The forward collision warning function will automatically activate when the vehicle restarts.
The forward collision warning function cannot handle all road conditions. Drivers need to always pay attention to road conditions and control the vehicle in a timely manner. This function will not activate at speeds below 30 km/h or in reverse. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the lane departure warning function is enabled, if the driver has not activated the turn signal or has no obvious intention to turn, but the system detects that the vehicle is departing from the current driving lane, this function will warn the driver through steering wheel vibration or by emitting sound and visual signals.
Lane departure warning is only a driver assistance function and is not always effective in all situations. The driver must always maintain control of the vehicle. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the lane keeping assistance function is enabled, if the driver has not activated the turn signal or has no obvious intention to turn, but the system detects that the vehicle is departing from the current driving lane, this function will assist in correcting the deviation by actively requesting steering.
Lane keeping assistance is only a driver assistance function and is not always effective in all situations. The driver must always maintain control of the vehicle. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the speed limit assistance switch is enabled, if adaptive cruise control or automatic centering assistance is activated, the system can automatically adjust the cruising speed according to the recognized speed limit information.
Speed limit assistance is only an auxiliary function and may not always correctly recognize speed limit information in all situations. The driver needs to always pay attention to road speed limits to avoid speeding. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the overspeed warning function is enabled, the system can alert the driver when the speedometer exceeds the recognized road speed limit, based on the alert method chosen by the driver.
The overspeed warning is only an auxiliary function and may not always correctly recognize speed limit information in all situations. Drivers need to always pay attention to the road traffic environment and drive safely and cautiously. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"The overspeed reminder offset option allows the driver to adjust the trigger timing of the overspeed reminder within a range of ±10 km/h of the road speed limit. The overspeed reminder will only be triggered when the speedometer exceeds the sum of the speed limit value and the set overspeed reminder offset value.
Drivers need to always pay attention to the road traffic environment and drive safely and cautiously. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the vehicle is moving at low speed, if the system detects obstacles around, the parking radar will emit an alarm sound, and the alarm volume can be adjusted to \'low\', \'medium\', or \'high\'.
The parking assistance system is only an auxiliary function and is limited by sensors. Some obstacles may not be detected due to being in a blind spot or other reasons, so you still need to pay attention to the surrounding environment during use."

"During parking, information such as text prompts is played in voice form, reducing the driver\'s time spent looking at the parking interface, making driving safer.
Voice broadcasting is just one way to present parking process information. Depending on the usage scenario (e.g., when voice broadcasting affects nearby passengers), the driver can turn off the voice broadcasting function."

"When the low-speed reverse emergency braking function is enabled, if the system determines there is a risk of collision with an obstacle in the vehicle\'s driving area while reversing, the vehicle will trigger emergency braking to avoid or mitigate the collision with the obstacle.
The low-speed reverse emergency braking function only acts to slow down or avoid collisions with rear obstacles when reversing. Due to sensor limitations, some obstacles may not be detected because they are in a blind spot or for other reasons, which may prevent the function from activating. Drivers must always pay attention to the vehicle\'s surroundings when reversing. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\' regarding ultrasonic sensors and 360 camera sensors."

"If the system detects a potential forward collision risk, it will trigger APB and automatically brake with a small deceleration, causing the vehicle to slow down or stop, enhancing user safety and comfort.
APB will brake to mitigate the risk of collision with vehicles ahead within a speed range of 0~80 km/h. The driver\'s actions can suppress the activation of the function. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the rear collision warning function is enabled, if the system detects a collision risk from the rear, it activates the hazard lights to warn the following vehicle; if a collision is unavoidable, it pre-tightens the seatbelt and activates the hazard lights (if the vehicle is stationary, it applies emergency braking to reduce whiplash injuries to occupants).
The rear collision warning is only an auxiliary function. Drivers must always pay attention to the road traffic environment and drive safely and cautiously. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"When the red light brake assist function is enabled, if the system detects a risk of running a red light, it alerts the driver through sound, images, and light braking. The timing of the alert can be selected through the sensitivity level below. If the driver does not brake or applies insufficient braking force after the alert, the system will automatically assist in braking to prevent running the red light.
The red light brake assist function is only an auxiliary function and may not correctly recognize traffic lights in all situations. Drivers must always pay attention to the traffic light status and drive safely and cautiously. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."

"The traffic light reminder function is enabled by default. When the vehicle approaches a traffic light intersection, the dashboard will display the current lane\'s traffic light shape (circle, arrow, U-turn light) and color (red, yellow, green). It will alert the driver through flashing and sound when the light changes to red or green. When there is no traffic light at the intersection, it will follow the car in front and alert the driver with sound and dashboard display when the car in front departs. Selecting \'Display\' excludes sound from the alert method, while selecting \'Beep\' includes sound.
The traffic light reminder function is only a proactive alert function and may not correctly recognize traffic lights or the car in front in all situations. Drivers must still pay attention to the road traffic environment when starting. For detailed warnings, instructions, and limitations of this function, please refer to the relevant sections in the \'User Manual\'."
"After disabling the lane departure warning, the system will not provide an alert when the vehicle departs from its lane. Are you sure you want to disable this function?"

"After disabling lane keeping assist, the system will not provide lane assistance when the vehicle departs from its lane, curb, or when there is a collision risk with a target in the adjacent lane. Are you sure you want to disable this function?"

"Dear Customer: Before using the NZP Autonomous Navigation and other related functions (hereinafter referred to as "related functions"), please carefully read the following content: The related functions are all auxiliary driving functions, aimed at enhancing driving convenience and comfort, and will not enable the vehicle to achieve autonomous driving. When using the related functions, the driver must always remain attentive, ensure the safety of the vehicle and the environment, and keep their hands on the steering wheel to be able to take over the vehicle or take corrective actions at any time. Do not rely entirely on the related functions for driving. The related functions are mainly designed for specific usage scenarios such as highways and elevated roads, requiring the presence of a median strip and clear lane markings, and meeting other necessary operating conditions. If there are pedestrians, construction scenes, adverse weather, or other unmet operating conditions, the related functions will be limited, and the driver needs to immediately take over the vehicle. The operation of the related functions requires the support of vehicle cameras, sensors, positioning systems, and other auxiliary driving components. Before enabling the related functions, please ensure that the auxiliary driving components are performing and working normally. This usage notice applies to the entire process of the driver using the related functions after confirming the activation of NZP Autonomous Navigation, until the vehicle is taken over or the related functions are turned off."

"Usage Requirements: Before using the related functions, the driver must confirm that they are aware of the detailed information of the NZP Autonomous Navigation function (see the \'User Manual\'), understand how to enable and cancel operations, and agree to the relevant information and data collection rules. Do you agree to all the above usage notice content and wish to enable NZP Autonomous Navigation?"

"Dear Customer: Before using the NZP Intelligent Navigation and other related functions (hereinafter referred to as "related functions"), please carefully read the following content: The related functions are all auxiliary driving functions, aimed at enhancing driving convenience and comfort, and will not enable the vehicle to achieve autonomous driving. When using the related functions, the driver must always remain attentive, ensure the safety of the vehicle and the environment, and keep their hands on the steering wheel to be able to take over the vehicle or take corrective actions at any time. Do not rely entirely on the related functions for driving. The related functions are mainly designed for specific usage scenarios such as highways and elevated roads, requiring the presence of a median strip and clear lane markings, and meeting other necessary operating conditions. If there are pedestrians, construction scenes, adverse weather, or other unmet operating conditions, the related functions will be limited, and the driver needs to immediately take over the vehicle. The operation of the related functions requires the support of vehicle cameras, sensors, positioning systems, and other auxiliary driving components. Before enabling the related functions, please ensure that the auxiliary driving components are performing and working normally. This usage notice applies to the entire process of the driver using the related functions after confirming the activation of NZP Intelligent Navigation, until the vehicle is taken over or the related functions are turned off. Enabling this function will simultaneously enable the lever lane change function."

"Usage Requirements: Before using the related functions, the driver must confirm that they are aware of the detailed information of the NZP Intelligent Navigation function (see the \'User Manual\'), understand how to enable and cancel operations, and agree to the relevant information and data collection rules. Do you agree to all the above usage notice content and wish to enable NZP Intelligent Navigation?"

"Dear Customer: Before using the NZP High-Speed Pilot and other related functions (hereinafter referred to as "related functions"), please carefully read the following content: The related functions are all auxiliary driving functions, aimed at enhancing driving convenience and comfort, and will not enable the vehicle to achieve autonomous driving. When using the related functions, the driver must always remain attentive, ensure the safety of the vehicle and the environment, and keep their hands on the steering wheel to be able to take over the vehicle or take corrective actions at any time. Do not rely entirely on the related functions for driving. The related functions are mainly designed for specific usage scenarios such as highways and elevated roads, requiring the presence of a median strip and clear lane markings, and meeting other necessary operating conditions. If there are pedestrians, construction scenes, adverse weather, or other unmet operating conditions, the related functions will be limited, and the driver needs to immediately take over the vehicle. The operation of the related functions requires the support of vehicle cameras, sensors, positioning systems, and other auxiliary driving components. Before enabling the related functions, please ensure that the auxiliary driving components are performing and working normally. This usage notice applies to the entire process of the driver using the related functions after confirming the activation of NZP High-Speed Pilot, until the vehicle is taken over or the related functions are turned off.
Usage Requirements: Before using the related functions, the driver must confirm that they are aware of the detailed information of the NZP High-Speed Pilot function (see the \'User Manual\'), understand how to enable and cancel operations, and agree to the relevant information and data collection rules.

"Dear User, please read the following instructions carefully: Attention! By enabling Race Mode ("this mode"), you fully understand and agree to accept all the following terms: (1) Race Mode is designed to provide the driver with a more technologically advanced and trendy cabin sound and light effects, as well as other auxiliary functions, to enhance driving pleasure. The driver must strictly comply with all legal and regulatory requirements while using this mode and must not engage in speeding, racing, or other dangerous driving behaviors on public roads or any other locations that do not meet the corresponding safety standards. Any personal injury or property damage resulting from the aforementioned behaviors is the driver\'s own risk and responsibility. (2) The driver is responsible for maintaining control of the vehicle at all times and ensuring the safety of the vehicle and the environment. Please operate cautiously under confirmed safe conditions. Do not manually adjust or operate parameter configurations while the vehicle is in motion, and do not become overly immersed in the various functional effects of this mode to prevent unforeseen consequences due to distraction. (3) In Race Mode, some vehicle function parameters will be adjusted. It is recommended to fully familiarize yourself with, experience, and confirm the acceptability of the relevant functional effects in a safe driving environment before using them to avoid discomfort or other adverse consequences due to unfamiliarity with the relevant functional effects. (4) After Race Mode is activated, all intelligent driving assistance functions such as driving, parking, and ADAS will be unavailable. If you need to use intelligent driving assistance functions, please exit Race Mode.
Usage Requirements: To activate Race Mode, the following conditions must be met: (1) The vehicle\'s drive system, brake system, ESC system, steering assistance system, and tire pressure must all be normal. If there is an abnormality, Race Mode cannot be entered. If currently in Race Mode, it will immediately exit. (2) The vehicle\'s battery level must be above 20%. If the battery level is below 20%, Race Mode will immediately exit. (3) The vehicle must be in D gear or P gear.
After Race Mode is activated: (1) Acceleration capability is adjusted to maximum. (2) Steering mode is adjusted to sport. (3) Damping mode is adjusted to sport. (4) ESC is adjusted to sport. (5) Electric seatbelt tightens (if the vehicle has this configuration). (6) Seat side bolsters tighten (if the vehicle has this configuration).
After Race Mode is activated, the following vehicle functions are supported (linkage functions require vehicle configuration support): (1) Race ambient lighting, default on (adjustable, and the setting will be automatically saved after adjustment). (2) Simulated engine sound, default on each time Race Mode is activated, can be manually turned off by the user. (3) Rotating screen automatically turns towards the driver (adjustable, and the setting will be automatically saved after adjustment). (4) Driver\'s side bolsters tighten (if the vehicle has this configuration). (5) Electric seatbelt tightens (if the vehicle has this configuration). (6) Race Mode APP is activated, displaying exclusive driving interface animations. (7) [ADAS system] is adjusted to an unavailable state.
I have fully understood and agree to the above instructions and confirm the activation of Race Mode. "
Ensure road safety before starting to experience more elements of driving pleasure
After enabling tank mode, turn on the indicator light, move in the direction of the indicator light, and exit when the indicator light returns to normal or the switch is turned off
Ensure road safety before starting to experience more elements of driving pleasure
After the function is enabled, the vehicle rotates in place
Please perform tank turns in a flat, open area with no people, and pay attention to the surrounding environment safety

"Dear User, Hello! You have chosen to disable the radar\'s obstacle avoidance input signal determination, which may bring the following additional risks. Please understand and confirm. (1) The vehicle will not be able to automatically stop this function based on the radar\'s obstacle avoidance signal, so the user needs to pay more attention to the safety around the vehicle at all times. (2) Due to road conditions, the vehicle may have corresponding displacement during rotation. Please always ensure your own safety and the safety of those around you and be responsible for it. (3) To ensure safety, please make sure not to activate this function on crowded or complex roads, as it may endanger your own safety and that of others around you. It is recommended to use it in open, flat, and spacious dirt or mud road areas. I have read and accepted the risk notification and confirm."
The tank turn function will automatically stop when the radar detects an obstacle
关闭行车位置信息上传开关后，将同时关闭与车辆定位相关的功能，请确认是否关闭？

"When the super ECO mode is turned on, certain comfort functions will be turned off and the power performance will be optimized to increase the cars driving range. Before turning on the super ECO mode, pay attention to the followings: 1. After the car is locked or being charged, the super ECO mode will be exited 2. The power performance will be weakened, and the driving mode will not be selectable 3. The AC function is turned off by default 4. Car refrigerator (if any), seat comfort, steering wheel heating, ambient lamp, entertainment applications, etc. are not available 5. Driving assistance function is disabled (longer time is taken to reactivate driving assistance function) 6. "Dear User, Hello! Welcome to use the \'Tank Turn\' function. To ensure your safety and the safety of those around you, please pay attention to and comply with the following matters. (1) Before enabling this function, please park the car in a flat, open area with no people, ensuring there are no obstacles around. (2) After the function switch is turned on, be sure to follow the instructions to operate and enable this function. The D gear is used for driving, the steering lever is used to select the rotation direction after being fully turned, and the brake pedal is used to pause the tank turn. (3) After the function is enabled, be sure to keep the steering wheel in a straight position and do not turn the steering wheel angle. (4) After enabling, the vehicle radar will default to detecting surrounding obstacles, but due to blind spots, obstructions, weather, etc., it still cannot fully ensure complete safety around (such as curbs, ditches, speed bumps, slopes, and poles will affect related safety), you are responsible for the safety after the function is enabled. (5) To ensure safety, please make sure not to enable this function on crowded or complex roads, as it may endanger your own safety and that of others around you. (6) After the function is enabled, the ESC light is on, the speed display on the dashboard shows 0, and the specified angle rotation cannot be accelerated by the throttle, all of which are required for normal control. The function will return to normal after exiting. (7) The recommended road condition for use is a flat, open area, but due to the uncertainty of the road surface, the vehicle may have some deviation during rotation. Please always ensure your own safety and that of those around you. (8) The tank turn is a low-speed, high-torque operation, and the drive system will generate heat during operation. Please do not operate for a long time; it is recommended to take an appropriate time interval after completing one circle to ensure sufficient cooling of the drive system. I have read and accepted the risk notification and confirm."

Please understand the expectations in advance and drive cautiously."

"Dear user, please read this instruction carefully: Warning: (1) Track mode is only for use on closed tracks or professional venues that meet national safety standards. It must not be used on public roads or any other places that do not meet the corresponding safety standards. Any personal injury or property damage caused by using track mode is the responsibility of the driver. (2) Track mode should be operated by drivers with professional driving skills and rich experience. The driver should have at least 3 years of driving experience. Please confirm if other conditions are required (3) The driver is responsible for maintaining control of the vehicle at all times and ensuring the safety of the vehicle and environment when using track mode. Please operate cautiously under confirmed safe conditions. Do not manually adjust and operate parameter configurations while driving to avoid distraction leading to unpredictable consequences. (4) In track mode, the screen will display additional data and information related to track mode. This data and information are for reference only. The driver should not rely on the displayed data and information during operation and should confirm the stability and safety of the vehicle\'s operating status when necessary. (5) Any damage or malfunction of the vehicle or components caused by using track mode is the responsibility of the driver and is not covered by the vehicle\'s warranty.
Usage requirements: (1) Switching to track mode requires ensuring the vehicle\'s battery level is >20% SOC. The vehicle\'s battery level should be above 40% SOC and the battery temperature should be within the suitable range (20~30℃) to achieve optimal performance. (2) The vehicle\'s power system, thermal management system, and braking system must all be normal to activate. If there is any abnormality, it will automatically exit. (3) After exiting track mode, leave the track scene as soon as possible. Re-enter track mode only after the vehicle\'s status has recovered. (4) When using track mode, it is recommended to use professional track suit accessories to ensure safety.
After track mode activation: (1) Power mode Sport+ (2) E-pedal and AutoHold are off by default (3) Four-wheel drive power, default 50%, adjustable (4) Steering force default level 10 or strong, adjustable (5) ESC default level 0 (off) (6) Energy recovery level defaults to 100% (high) (7) Air suspension (if any) lowered to the minimum
Explanation of personal information collection and use: 1. Track mode review: To provide you with track mode services, we need to process the external images captured by the DVR locally on the vehicle to determine whether your vehicle is on the track. 2. Track mode vehicle tuning customization: To provide you with track mode vehicle tuning customization services, we need to collect your vehicle stability, torque distribution, energy recovery, and steering gear settings information and upload it to the cloud. 3. Track mode best/record best performance display: To provide you with track mode best/record best performance display services, we need to collect your lap time, current lap number, highest speed, lap deviation, track name, record date, record time, total mileage, and total duration, and upload it to the cloud. 4. Track mode video playback: To provide you with track mode video playback services, we need to collect your account ID, account avatar, account nickname, and external images captured by the DVR, and upload them to the cloud. 5. Friend performance ranking: To provide you with friend performance ranking services, we need to collect your account ID, account avatar, account nickname, account rank, track name, vehicle model, lap time, maximum speed, and video upload time, and upload them to the cloud. 6. Drift mode performance display: To provide you with drift mode performance display services, we need to collect your total time using drift mode, maximum steering wheel angle, maximum vehicle angle, maximum lateral/longitudinal acceleration, and drift kilometers, and upload them to the cloud.
I have fully understood and agree to the above instructions and confirm to enable track mode."

ZEEKR Lab Feature Service Terms

Zhejiang Geely Intelligent Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter referred to as "we") provides you with ZEEKR Lab feature services under the premise of ensuring functional safety and controllability, to enhance, improve, or perfect vehicle functions and further enhance user experience. The ZEEKR Lab features include multiple specific feature options, such as cinema mode, etc., and we will update the specific feature content from time to time. By using ZEEKR Lab features, you can experience experimental features and/or modes that are being tested.

Since ZEEKR Lab features are experimental features being tested on vehicles, although they comply with legal and regulatory requirements, there are still certain uncertainties during the operation of the features due to network and other objective environmental limitations. We are committed to improving your related experience during use and will continuously take appropriate safety protection measures according to regulatory requirements and mature industry safety standards to protect your personal and property safety.

Before using this feature, please confirm that you are the legal owner or user of this vehicle and have the right or have been authorized to use ZEEKR Lab features. If you are not the aforementioned personnel, please do not use ZEEKR Lab features. The legal consequences of personal and property losses caused by unauthorized use or failure to follow relevant safety operation requirements shall be borne by the corresponding responsible party, and we do not assume responsibility.

Before using ZEEKR Lab features, please be sure to read and fully understand these service terms and the prompt instructions of related features, ensure that the vehicle is in a suitable state for using the corresponding features, and understand the corresponding features and precautions before operation. If there are any uncertainties or unfamiliar situations, please contact our 400 customer service hotline (4000-036-036) for consultation. We will highlight terms that require your special attention in bold, please be sure to read them carefully.

If you choose to agree to use ZEEKR Lab features, it means you accept these service terms and fully understand the content and corresponding impact of ZEEKR Lab features. If you choose not to agree, you will not be able to use ZEEKR Lab features.



I. Precautions for Using ZEEKR Lab Features

1.1 Since ZEEKR Lab features are experimental features being tested, there may be certain risks, including but not limited to:

1) Directly or indirectly causing certain essential vehicle functions to fail to start normally;

2) May cause partial or complete data loss and inability to recover;

3) Termination of vehicle network services or suspension of this feature, etc.

1.2 We will independently determine, change, and adjust the user list and scope of ZEEKR Lab features.

1.3 We have the right to suspend or terminate the provision of ZEEKR Lab features to you at any time or take some or all features offline within this feature. The offline of this feature does not affect the legal effect generated by your previous use of this feature. Moreover, we do not guarantee that all or part of the experimental features within this feature will necessarily be applied to the vehicle application platform.

1.4 Some features within ZEEKR Lab features will be automatically set to on or off by the system by default after you are aware of the relevant instructions of the feature, and you can turn them off and on in the corresponding interface.

1.5 You acknowledge and agree that we are not responsible for any data loss, terminal equipment damage, or any other loss caused by your use of ZEEKR Lab features.



II. Applicable Law and Dispute Resolution

2.1 The establishment, effectiveness, interpretation, revision, supplementation, termination, execution, and dispute resolution of these service terms are governed by the laws of the People\'s Republic of China.

2.2 Any disputes related to or arising from these service terms shall be resolved through friendly negotiation between the parties; if negotiation fails, either party has the right to file a lawsuit with the people\'s court at the defendant\'s domicile.

"Dear user, please read this user manual carefully: Warning: 1. Track mode is only for use on closed race tracks or professional venues that meet national safety standards. It must not be used on public roads or any other locations that do not meet the corresponding safety standards. Any personal injury or property damage caused by using track mode is the responsibility of the driver. 2. Track mode should be operated by drivers with professional driving skills and extensive experience. The driver should have at least 6 years of driving experience [A1]. 3. The driver is responsible for maintaining control of the vehicle at all times and ensuring the safety of the vehicle and environment when using track mode. Please operate cautiously under confirmed safe conditions. Do not manually adjust or operate parameter configurations while driving to avoid distractions that could lead to unforeseen consequences. 4. In track mode, the screen will display additional data and information related to track mode. This data and information are for reference only. The driver should not rely on the displayed data and information and should independently confirm the stability and safety of the vehicle\'s operating status when necessary. 5. Any vehicle or component damage and malfunctions caused by using track mode are the responsibility of the driver and are not covered under the vehicle\'s warranty. Usage requirements: Switching to track mode requires the vehicle\'s battery level to be >20% SOC (TBD). The vehicle\'s battery level should be above 40% SOC and the battery temperature should be within the suitable range (20~30℃) to achieve optimal performance. The vehicle\'s power system, thermal management system, and braking system must all be normal to activate. If there are any abnormalities, it will automatically exit; after exiting track mode, leave the track scene as soon as possible and wait for the vehicle status to recover before re-entering track mode. When using track mode, it is recommended to use professional track accessories to ensure safety. After activating track mode: 1. Power mode Sport+; 2. E-pedal and AutoHold are off by default; 3. Four-wheel drive power, default 50%, adjustable. 4. Steering force default level 10 or strong, adjustable. 5. ESC default level 0 (off). 6. Energy recovery level defaults to 100% (high). 7. Air suspension lowered to the minimum. 8. To ensure vehicle power performance, AC is off by default. To monitor vehicle status and perform analysis and diagnostics, we will collect real-time information on the vehicle\'s location, speed, driving status, and battery status after starting track mode. We will use the DVR recording system to record your driving situation in the current mode and send and store it in your smart cockpit with end-to-end encryption. You can download or delete the recordings locally. Due to national laws and regulations, our remote viewing function of the recordings is only supported on the track. You can upload them yourself through "Video Center - Video Details". After review and confirmation that it was recorded on the track, you can view the track videos on the APP [A3]. I have fully understood and agree to the above user manual and confirm to enable track mode."

"Dear Customer: The Zeekr automotive application platform has provided you with a wide variety of in-car entertainment content. To prevent safety hazards caused by driver distraction while the vehicle is in motion, we have set the system default to prohibit the use of video entertainment content during driving ("Driving Entertainment Restriction"). You may choose to manually disable the "Driving Entertainment Restriction" function only after you have confirmed and fully agreed to all the terms below. Once the "Driving Entertainment Restriction" function is disabled, some video entertainment content on the Zeekr automotive application platform can still be used even if your vehicle is in D, N, or R gear, but the service target of the video entertainment content should only be passengers: (1) During vehicle operation, it is strictly forbidden for the driver to watch videos or perform any other operations that hinder safe driving. (2) During vehicle operation, if the driver believes that certain video entertainment content used by passengers affects or may affect driving safety, the driver should immediately turn off such video entertainment content or directly enable the "Driving Entertainment Restriction" function. (3) The driver is responsible for driving safety and all actions during vehicle operation. If the driver or passengers violate the aforementioned terms or engage in any other operations or behaviors that hinder safe driving, resulting in personal injury, property damage, or any other risks and responsibilities (including but not limited to all claims, damages, losses, costs, and administrative penalties arising therefrom), they shall be borne by the driver or vehicle owner; Zeekr Automotive assumes no responsibility."

\u0009\u0009\u0009 We hereby declare that the IHU log information we collect will not be actively associated with your personal information. However, it is not ruled out that the system may contain personal information related to your use during operation.
